selectedpapers.title: Evaluating and extending speedup techniques for optimal crossing minimization in layered graph drawings
selectedpapers.summary: We categorize the state-of-the-art linear programming formulations for exact crossing minimization on layered networks and evaluate nine new and existing techniques. Through an expansive computational evaluation, we explore how the techniques assist or inhibit one another. Our best-performing techniques yielded a median improvement of 2.5-17x depending on the solver used.

selectedpapers.title: A collection of benchmark datasets for evaluating graph layout algorithms
selectedpapers.summary: We built a website to help graph drawing researchers find benchmark datasets to use for evaluating graph layout algorithms.

selectedpapers.title: Fast and readable layered network visualizations using large neighborhood search
selectedpapers.summary: Graph layout algorithms that reduce edge crossings and shorten edges generally fall into two camps—quick heuristics, and optimal methods that prioritize human readability over computation speed. This work uses an optimization metaheuristic to provide the best of both worlds: high-quality layouts within a predetermined execution time.
